div.p:
(7 Apprehension had I of her danger insomuch
had Ashburner assured me she was going on well
(I remember his expression she may build Chateaux
on Espagne now -if she pleases)
that I accepted yesterday morning actually
yesterday morning an invitation which had
been a dozen times repeated [deletion]& wished for[/deletion] by
M[superscript]r[/superscript] Rogers to go to one of his breakfasts [deletion]& it was[/deletion]
a breakfast made on purpose for me with carte
blanche for my kith & kin whom Rogers discovered
good natured man to be essential to my pleasure

Capt[superscript]n[/superscript] Beaufort, thinks of that too! wished to
go and asked me to introduce him & Honora and
Rosa and Emily all dined much to [unclear][/unclear] so they
had invites special and Lestock but he c[superscript]d[/superscript] not

So we all went and saw his fine pictures
& all his delightful things himself by far the
most delightful among them notwithstanding
all that nature did to forbid - If not the best
worth seeing Rogers is certainly one of the men best
worth hearing of modern conversation men

Too [unclear]tender[/unclear] there was an admirable break
fast and we had it and him & all of it to ourselves
the only thing I thought de trop was
one of the footmen - there were two in
waiting all Breakfast now one I
thought was [unclear][/unclear] de trop -
in former times 20 years or 10 years
ago one footman or man of some kind
at a private breakfast was enough for a [underline]marquess [/underline]or [underline]quis[/underline]

But let this pass nobody complained of it - and I
enjoyed the full and complete satisfaction of seeing
all my kith and kin pleased - delighted - even
the fastidious captain his self -

But only think how near pleasure & pain - feast
ing & revelry and all that happened that night
At parting with Rogers he holding both my hands
so pressed me to come back again & breakfast once more all
[unclear][/unclear] - yes these young ones whom I find [unclear]are of[/unclear][unclear][/unclear]
8) have adopted" that I could not refuse the dear dead
dandy the sincerely good natured benevolent
flattering sensitive sensible charming ugly oldest
of men extant - so I accepted for Monday or Wednesday
& agreed to write and say which -

And this day I have been writing to him to
say how it is with us now! - And to break this
and all other engagements specially one with
Lady Cornwallis the object & cause of which I have
not time here to explain nor can you care about
it - at present.

I will now make up my packet that I
may go into the post this sunday night for that
much it [underline]can[/underline] do and that will secure its going
by first mail that steams -

Never did I see a more tender kind husband
than Lestock - [unclear]Mariguetta [/unclear] may think or say
what she pleases about Francis! - he has never
been so tried & I hope never will
div.closer:
Farewell dearest mother & do let your
self be taken care of & your legs tied till you
are fit to go - or come Yours affectionately
Maria Edgeworth
